Title: Internal Audit Plan 2022-2023

   The dataset, available at [https://fsa-catalogue2.s3.eu-west-2.amazonaws.com/AnnualAuditAssurancePlan2022-23.csv](https://fsa-catalogue2.s3.eu-west-2.amazonaws.com/AnnualAuditAssurancePlan2022-23.csv), is a comprehensive list of planned internal audits for the year range 2022 to 2023. The data is presented in a CSV format for easy access and analysis. Each row of the dataset contains information about an individual audit, including the specific area or department being audited, the purpose of the audit, the expected outcome, and other relevant details. This data is intended for internal use by the organization to ensure compliance with regulations, maintain operational efficiency, and manage risk effectively. The dataset serves as a valuable resource for stakeholders who wish to understand the organization's internal audit strategy for the upcoming years.

The dataset titled "Internal Audit Plan" is a list that outlines various internal audits scheduled for a specific year, as indicated in the link provided (AnnualAuditAssurancePlan2022-23.csv). This data set is likely used by organizations to manage and monitor their internal processes, systems, and compliance with regulations or industry standards. The audits detailed within this dataset are planned for the 2022-23 fiscal year. The organization responsible for maintaining this data is not explicitly specified, but it can be assumed that it pertains to a financial services authority or similar entity given the nature of the data and link provided.

Title: Internal Audit Plan 2021-22 Dataset
   Summary: This dataset provides details about the planned internal audits for the given period (2021-2022). It includes various audits organized according to their execution year, thereby offering a comprehensive overview of the organization's audit schedule. The dataset can be accessed via the following link: [Internal Audit Plan 2021-22 CSV File](https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2021-22.csv).

The "Internal Audit Plan" dataset is a structured list of internal audits that have been planned for a specific time period, namely from 2020 to 2021. The data is presented in a CSV (Comma Separated Values) format and can be accessed at the provided link: <https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2020-21.csv>. This dataset presumably details various internal audit activities that an organization has scheduled to ensure its operations are functioning efficiently, effectively, and in compliance with established policies, regulations, and standards. The audits covered within this plan likely span across different areas of the organization, including but not limited to financial, operational, IT, compliance, and risk management, among others. The specific details about each audit, such as its purpose, scope, methodology, and expected outcomes, are likely contained in the individual rows of the CSV file.

The "Internal Audit Plan" dataset is a structured list of internal audits that have been planned for the years 2019 and 2020. This data can be found at the URL: https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2019-20.csv. The dataset is likely to contain details such as audit names, dates, departments or areas of focus, and potential findings or recommendations for improvement. It serves as a guide for the internal auditing team within an organization, helping them ensure that all necessary checks are carried out effectively and efficiently to maintain integrity, comply with regulations, and promote continuous improvement.

The "Internal Audit Plan" dataset, as indicated by its title, is a comprehensive list of internal audits that were planned for implementation during the year range specified in the link to the CSV file (https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2018-19.csv). The data provided covers the audits that were scheduled for the 2018-19 financial year, but it is possible that similar datasets may exist for other years as well.

The purpose of this dataset is to provide transparency and accountability within an organization by outlining the various internal audits that were planned to be carried out. These audits are likely intended to evaluate the effectiveness of an organization's risk management, control, and governance processes to ensure compliance with established policies, standards, and regulations.

The dataset is structured in a tabular format, with each row representing an individual audit, and columns providing information about that audit such as its title, description, responsible party, start and end dates, and any associated documents or links for further reference. The specific details of the audits, including their scope, objectives, and expected outcomes, would be contained within the descriptions provided in each row.

Title: Internal Audit Plan 2017-18
   Summary: The dataset provides an organized list of internal audits that were planned for the fiscal years 2017 and 2018. This data is accessible via a CSV file located at https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2017-18.csv. The dataset contains specific details about each audit, including the year it was planned for, an identifier or name for the audit, and possibly other relevant information such as the department or area of focus, objectives, scope, and potential findings. This data serves as a reference for understanding the internal audits conducted by the organization during these years, helping stakeholders to monitor the effectiveness of internal controls and ensure compliance with established policies and regulations.

Title: Internal Audit Plan 2016-2017

   Summary: This dataset is a comprehensive list of internal audits that were planned for the years 2016 and 2017. The data is presented in a CSV (Comma Separated Values) format, which can be easily read by various software applications like Microsoft Excel, LibreOffice Calc, or Google Sheets. Each row represents an individual audit, containing information such as the audit name, description, responsible department, and the planned year(s).

   The dataset provides valuable insights into the organization's internal audit activities for a two-year period, helping stakeholders to understand the scope and focus areas of these audits. This data can be used by analysts, researchers, or anyone interested in examining trends, identifying potential gaps, or assessing the effectiveness of the internal audit process over time.

   Link: [Internal Audit Plan 2016-2017](https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2016-2017.csv)

Title: Internal Audit Plan 2015-2016
   Summary: This dataset provides a comprehensive list of internal audits that were planned for the years 2015 and 2016. The data is structured in a CSV (Comma Separated Values) format, available at https://fsadata.github.io/internal-audit-plan/data/internal-audit-plan-2015-2016.csv.

   Each row in the CSV represents an individual internal audit, with columns detailing information such as the audit name, the specific area or department within the organization being audited, the planned start and end dates of the audit, and any other relevant details. The data is likely to have been compiled by the organization's internal audit department, offering a valuable insight into their quality assurance and compliance efforts over the specified period.

   The dataset could be useful for various purposes such as understanding historical audit trends, comparing audit focus areas across years, or benchmarking internal audit practices within the same industry. Researchers, auditors, policymakers, and stakeholders may find this data particularly helpful in their respective fields of interest.
